intro: Kuruna walkeriana, commonly known as the Walker's kuruna, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, Kuruna walkeriana is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
